Disbandment of S. Korea-U.S. Combined Forces Command Urged in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea reportedly made public on Nov. 8 a statement in which it demanded the south Korean and U.S. authorities immediately disband the vertical and unilateral south Korea-U.S. Combined Forces Command.
 The statement said that the command has done nothing but having played the role as a military mechanism preferentially meeting the military and strategic demands of the U.S. in the past, keeping the south Korean forces under the command and control of the U.S. forces.
 Now that the movement to achieve national cooperation through reconciliation and cooperation between the south and north is mounting higher than ever before the disbandment of the military organization aimed at invading the north brooks no further delay.    
 This aggressive military organization of the U.S. imperialists should be disbanded before anything else to force the U.S. forces to pull out of south Korea and have the shackling "south Korea-U.S. alliance" scrapped, the statement stressed.

Elimination of Ultra-Right Conservative Forces Urged in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- The youths and students should eliminate all ultra-right conservative forces keen to damage the dignity of the nation by opposing the north and reunification and build a new society suited to the June 15 era of reunification. The South Headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification stated this in a commentary issued on Nov. 7 assailing the Grand National Party and other ultra-right anti-reunification and treacherous forces for forming a new organization called "National League of New Right."
 The commentary said: There is no difference between the GNP and the "New Right." The organization which claims to be the "New Right" asserted that "it is different from the "Old Right" such as the GNP, a leftover representative of politics in the bygone days. But it groups almost all riffraffs of conservative political forces including heads of the GNP, the Party Centered on People and the Democratic Party. This league put the slogan "Let's protect the 60 year-old legacies of the right wing". This means preserving the legacies of pro-Japanese and pro-American elements and its loudmouthed "liberalism" is, in essence, a call for opposing the north and reunification. Its ultimate goal is confrontation and war.    
 The conservative forces' worship-America nature can never change. There is no future for the nation unless the ultra-right conservative forces including the GNP are thrown overboard.

articles.title: Officials of Ministries and National Institutions Visit Mangyongdae Revolutionary Museum
Formation of New Umbrella Body of Conservatives in S. Korea Flailed
articles.content:
Officials of Ministries and National Institutions Visit Mangyongdae Revolutionary Museum
    Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- New historic materials have been displayed at the Mangyongdae Revolutionary Museum on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's first visit to his native home in Mangyongdae on Oct. 14, Juche 34 (1945) after the liberation of Korea.
 On Friday the museum was visited by Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju, Choe Thae Bok, Yang Hyong Sop, Choe Yong Rim, Kim Kuk Thae, Kim Ki Nam, Kim Jung Rin and Kim Yong Dae, chairman of the Central Committee of the Korean Social Democratic Party, Ryu Mi Yong, chairperson of the Central Committee of the Korean Chondoist Chongu Party, and leading officials of the ministries, national institutions and working people's organizations.
 The visitors looked round historic materials and relics on display in rooms, being briefed on the revolutionary life of the President growing as a great revolutionary and the immortal feats performed by the revolutionary family members in firmly carrying forward the lineage of the family of Mangyongdae. 
 They keenly felt again that the President is a peerlessly great man, while seeing a large electronic board and video show reflecting the 8,000-odd-km long journey including the "250-mile journey for learning" and the "250-mile journey for national liberation" made by the President in his childhood, feeling in his bones the sorrow and pain of the nation who lost its country.    
 Then they went round the native home in Mangyongdae.

DPRK Delegation Returns from Six-Party Talks
    Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- The DPRK delegation led by Kim Kye Gwan, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, returned home Saturday after participating in the six-party talks on the nuclear issue between the DPRK and the U.S. held in Beijing.
 The delegation was greeted at the airport by Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, officials concerned, Wu Donghe, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and Oleg Davydov, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Russian embassy here.
